ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.datamanager

Interface DataManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CachedDataManager, HttpDataManager, JsonDataManager, LocalDataManager

    public interface DataManager
    A base interface for a class acting as a data manager for arbitrary types of objects. The implementations work with DataKey to uniquely map the objects to paths on whatever storage media they are using. Created by rishi on 15-10-29.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean deleteIfExists(DataKey key)
      Deletes the object pointed by the DataKey from the storage media, if it exists.
      <T> T getData(DataKey key, java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
      Retrieves the data pointed to by the key from the storage media.
      boolean isOperational()
      Checks if the storage media used by this DataManager implementation is currently operational or online.
      boolean keyExists(DataKey key)
      Checks if the DataKey exists in the storage media.
      <T> void writeData(DataKey key, T obj, java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
      Write the object to the storage, or overwrites the existing one if one existed.

    • Method Detail

      • keyExists

        boolean keyExists(DataKey key)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the DataKey exists in the storage media.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be looked up.
        Returns:
        True, if the key exists, else false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • getData

        <T> T getData(DataKey key,
            java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the data pointed to by the key from the storage media.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object being retrieved. This type should match with the parameter "typeOfT", else a ClassCastException might be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey to be used for lookup.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object being retrieved.
        Returns:
        The retrieved object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • writeData

        <T> void writeData(DataKey key,
                 T obj,
                 java.lang.reflect.Type typeOfT)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Write the object to the storage, or overwrites the existing one if one existed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey for the object.
        obj - The object to be stored.
        typeOfT - The Type of the object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • deleteIfExists

        boolean deleteIfExists(DataKey key)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes the object pointed by the DataKey from the storage media, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        key - The DataKey for which the object has to be deleted.
        Returns:
        True, if the object was found and was deleted. False, if the object was not found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown, if the communication to the storage media fails.

      • isOperational

        boolean isOperational()
        Checks if the storage media used by this DataManager implementation is currently operational or online.
        Returns:
        True, if the DataManager is completely operational, else false. Some operations might still work if false is returned.
